alert.note: Alert for Hall (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 09 at 6:19PM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Hall County through 645 PM CDT... At 615 PM, storm spotters sighted a possible cold air funnel north of Wood River in Hall County. Cold air funnels are not associated with strong thunderstorms but are usually reported within or near showers or very weak thunderstorms. Cold air funnels form as the updraft of a shower or very weak thunderstorm stretches very small pre-existing areas of rotation into funnels, similar to a landspout. Cold air funnels usually last for only a short period of time and normally do not come in contact with the ground. They typically pose no threat to public safety. If they do touch down, it is usually for a very brief period and the damage is relatively minor. Locations impacted include... Wood River and Alda. This includes Interstate 80 between mile markers 302 and 311. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
